data.label:
Narrator

We disembarked in front of Palas Rezna. It was time for the reception.

Narrator

The day of Vina's wedding had finally arrived.

Narrator

It was time to face the facts. The royal wedding was off.

Narrator

Citizens waved Rizian and Palesian flags from their balconies as our carriage procession wound through the streets of Porte Drazon, flanked by the Golden Guard.

Narrator

Citizens waved Rizian flags and House Toras crests from their balconies as our carriage procession wound through the streets of Porte Drazon, flanked by the Golden Guard and members of Su Omina.

Narrator

Vina had refused to take my arm as we walked down the aisle together. She had a determined steeliness in her eyes as she joined Rico at the altar.

Narrator

As per tradition, the newlyweds shared their first kiss on the Zilba steps in front of the public. Neither paid attention to the cheering throngs as they passionately locked lips.

Narrator

There was an undeniable spark between them. It wasn't love yet, but it could be.

Narrator

The Queen Mother was by my side as we entered the Grand Hall. She was wearing a deep violet hat adorned with peacock feathers. I heard a few giggles as the photographers took our picture.

Lucita Azaro

"Was this a mistake? Too much, too quickly?"

Estela Toras

"Remember to smile, darling. It's your daughter's wedding day."

Estela Toras

"Worry about that after dinner."

Estela Toras

"All the more reason for jubilation."

Estela Toras

"Nonsense. You need a break. The kingdom needs a break."

Estela Toras

"Then show it. The world is watching."

Player_Romus

"Relax. That's what the wedding committee is for."

Pabel Adria

"Sure."

Pabel Adria

"It hasn't even been 24 hours. Give me time to get into the noble mindset."

Narrator

Pabel shook our hands before helping us into our seats.

Estela Toras

"Why, thank you. I'm happy someone in this palace appreciates haute couture."

Pabel Adria

"Resources were limited, but I did what I could."

Pabel Adria

"I would never."

Narrator

Hugo and his wife Rita had reached the table. Pabel quickly pulled out their chairs.

Narrator

Angelica Sazon approached our table.

Narrator

Hugo and his wife Rita had reached the table. Pabel bowed in acknowledgement.

Narrator

Angelica laughed warmly.

Narrator

Her eyes narrowed slightly.

Angelica Sazon

"I understand your feelings. I myself gave up my name for that of the Sazons."

Angelica Sazon

"That is my hope as well."

Hugo Toras

"I assume your place of honor at this table reflects your great importance to the kingdom in this time of war."

Narrator

Vina's shimmering white gown trailed behind her as she and Axel strode through the Grand Hall arm in arm, waving to the cheering guests with practiced ease.

Player_Romus

"Ah, yes, the ritualistic parade of gifts and flattery. If I must suffer through it, so be it."

Estela Toras

"Sit up straighter, dear. Don't forget you're the princess of two countries now."

Hugo Toras

"Now, Rico. Have more respect for your grandmother-in-law."

Manus Sazon

"Diplomatic duties call, Your Highness."

Narrator

Queen Beatrice was first in line to greet us.

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"Duke Ricardus. I hope being married to my niece will keep you out of trouble."

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"Mr. Sazon. I hope marriage to my niece will keep you from stirring up trouble."

Manus Sazon

"More likely the opposite, Your Excellency."

Narrator

President Wiktor Smolak bowed low before our table.

Player_Romus

"Indeed. I had no idea such a simple object could serve so many functions."

Estela Toras

"You have my gratitude, Mr. President. For your good wishes, and for finally honoring your promise to return my parents' homeland."

Reinhart

Reinhart

Sordland Congrats

Sordland Congrats

Toast

Toast

Narrator

Beatrice gave me a strange look.

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"Mr. Sazon. You seem to be enjoying success after success lately."

Narrator

Her eyes came to rest on Lucita.

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"You're the gentleman who makes such marvelous tea."

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"You are too kind, Duchess Azaro."

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"I am ever so glad that Rumburg was able to help you gain an edge over the Palesians. I am fully confident in your ability to win this war."

Narrator

Flanked by the Golden Guard and members of Su Omina, an armored car drove us through cleared-out streets until we reached Palas Rezna. It was time for the reception.

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"I am ever so sorry that we could not do more to help you gain an edge against the Palesians."

Narrator

Beatrice gave her an unusually wide smile.

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"You're the warrior noblewoman I've heard so much about."

Pabel Adria

"It's Rumburg's fertile soil that makes the leaves sing, Your Excellency."

Player_Romus

"Have you brought us a gift, or merely come to shoot the breeze?"

Player_Romus

"Thank you for coming, Beatrice. We'll have to squeeze in a visit to your new port while you're here."

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"That would be splendid."

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"Of course."

Beatrice Livingston (R)

"She lived for such occasions. Always ready with a perfectly worded toast."

Narrator

With a final curtsy, she departed to the table she shared with her husband and sons.

Smolak Congrats

Smolak Congrats

Rico Toras

"You do not need to apologize to me, Mr. President."

Rico Toras

"And I deeply regret that Rizia was unable to help you solve your Bludish problem--"

Axel Reinhart

"Between Pales' gas and Wehlen's oil, this new South Merkopan alliance the King is initiating will be a force to be reckoned with."

Player_Romus

"I do not think of it as reclamation. We are turning the Rizo-Palesian peninsula into the unified whole it was always meant to be."

Player_Romus

"Nothing is as glorious as seeing my daughter wed, Mr. Smolak."

Player_Romus

"What is truly glorious is sitting here with the people I care about most in the world."

Narrator

Wiktor's eyes gleamed.

Player_Romus

"Glory comes later. For now, I still have work to do."

Narrator

His expression stayed jubilant as he addressed Manus and Angelica.

Narrator

Axel nodded proudly.

Narrator

Axel gave me an uneasy look.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Anyway. New alliances, a handsome new son-in-law... what a glorious era this must be for you, Your Majesty."

Narrator

Vina barely kept herself from rolling her eyes.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Always so serious, Your Majesty. You should allow yourself to have fun now and again."

Narrator

Lucita squeezed my leg under the table.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I hope I'm invited to the grand reunification ceremony."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Your love for the Princess is truly touching. I hope my little one grows up to be like you, Your Highness."

Narrator

Duke Reinhart was next. On his arm was a platinum-blonde woman of stunning proportions.

Axel Reinhart

"My sincerest of congratulations, Your Highness."

Narrator

He let her go and bowed before Vina.

Vina Toras

"Thank you, Axel."

Vina Toras

"Thank you, Your Grace. Won't you be so kind as to introduce your date?"

Axel Reinhart

"A brand new Southern Merkopan alliance, powered by Palesian gas -- and Rizian, of course."

Player_Romus

"More importantly, said changes will be cosmetic at most."

Player_Romus

"To the contrary. They will improve our populace's welfare, and consequently strengthen the global image of our alliance."

Axel Reinhart

"I'm glad you find something admirable about us. Your brother didn't."

Player_Romus

"This is a happy occasion. Do not soil it by bringing up my father."

Player_Romus

"My father fell under the spell of a religious fanatic. His actions were not his own."

Axel Reinhart

"Agreed."

Axel Reinhart

"I suppose we'll never know."

Player_Romus

"Rizia and Pales have more in common than my father ever admitted. I am glad we are recognizing those commonalities now."

Narrator

He took his date's elbow and strolled off.

Player_Romus

"You should be congratulating my daughter, not me."

Anton Rayne (R)

"Of course. You must be proud of her."

Anton Rayne (R)

"She seems so intelligent and self-possessed. Not at all like my dullard of a son."

Anton Rayne (R)

"She seems so intelligent and self-possessed. I hope my kids can meet her someday."

Anton Rayne (R)

"Any enemy of ATO is a friend of mine."

Anton Rayne (R)

"I told my secretary to mark my calendar as soon as I got the invitation."

Anton Rayne (R)

"Any friend of Wehlen's is a friend of mine."

Anton Rayne (R)

"We reformists have to stick together."

Anton Rayne (R)

"My wife Monica sends her regrets. Some sort of feminine issue -- I didn't want to ask for details."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"Marcel Koronti, Your Majesty. A pleasure to finally meet you."

Narrator

The Sordish oligarch bowed elegantly and smoothed out his expensive-looking tuxedo.

Anton Rayne (R)

"We've got as much riding on our business partnership as you do."

Anton Rayne (R)

"A pleasure, ma'am. I have many female cabinet members as well."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"It couldn't be better. Your beaches make our Benfi look like a child's sandbox."

Player_Romus

"I'm honored you could take time out of your schedule to make it."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"I've hardly had a moment to breathe since taking over as head of the Lotherberg Group, it's true. But it is not every day that one gets the opportunity to attend a Rizian royal wedding."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"I must say I expected something a little more lavish. I'll have to invite you to my own marriage celebrations so you can see how luxurious a wedding can be."

Player_Romus

"You weren't on the guest list."

Player_Romus

"Congratulations on your recent promotion."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"I happened to be visiting when Anton called me. It's not every day one gets the chance to attend a Rizian royal wedding."

Narrator

The Sordish president kissed my daughter's hand.

Anton Rayne (R)

"Your intelligence and self-possession are remarkable. I hope my kids can meet you someday."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"Heart of Sordland keeps me busy, it's true. But it is not every day that one gets the opportunity to attend a Rizian royal wedding."

Petr Vectern (R)

"Petr Vectern, Your Majesty. At your service."

Player_Romus

"The president and vice president of Sordland at my daughter's wedding? What an honor."

Petr Vectern (R)

"I'll tell you what's an honor. Meeting the one and only Party Prince in the flesh."

Petr Vectern (R)

"I'll tell you what's an honor. Meeting the one and only King of Rizia in the flesh."

Narrator

Vina had a polite smile frozen on her face.

Player_Romus

"Welcome to Rizia, Mr. Vice President. Please, feel at home among our family and friends."

Petr Vectern (R)

"Seriously, it's great to be here. You know, I got a nice piece of Rizian gold from Rusty Montoro once."

Petr Vectern (R)

"I wonder how much it's worth now that he's in prison? What do you think, Your Highness?"

Petr Vectern (R)

"I wonder how much it's worth now? What do you think, Your Highness?"

Petr Vectern (R)

"I do, Your Majesty. Very much so."

Petr Vectern (R)

"I've had my share of Rizian wine before, of course, but it's so much better straight from the source."

Narrator

He subtly tapped the side of his nose.

Petr Vectern (R)

"Do you still party, Party Prince?"

Player_Romus

"Let's talk later."

Player_Romus

"Not anymore."

Petr Vectern (R)

"Pardon my vulgarity, but if I were king of this place, I'd be blitzed round the clock."

Player_Romus

"President Rayne, I trust you to keep your guest from tarnishing your republic's fine reputation."

Player_Romus

"Not as much as I used to."

Player_Romus

"Who says I'm not?"

Player_Romus

"Your candor is welcoming, Mr. Vice President. A breath of fresh air in these staid premises."

Petr Vectern (R)

"You got it. Remind me to invite you to my gentleman's club next time you're in Sordland."

Petr Vectern (R)

"Too bad. I was looking forward to seeing if the stories were true."

Petr Vectern (R)

"You're telling me."

Player_Romus

"I do. Join me aboard {Salutations.RoyalJet} sometime."

Narrator

The Sordish president politely nudged his companion.

Petr Vectern (R)

"Ha! Remind me to invite you to my gentleman's club next time you're in Sordland."

Narrator

His eyes wandered over to Manus.

Narrator

His eyes wandered over to Axel.

Narrator

Hugo breathed an audible sigh of relief as the Sordish delegation left.

Player_Romus

"It would be an honor, Mr. Koronti. Please join me aboard the Riziania anytime."

Player_Romus

"Lavish isn't our style here in Rizia. We prefer to spend the fruits of our prosperity on our people."

Player_Romus

"A bit of spectacle here and there keeps the populace happy."

Player_Romus

"Today is about love. Not brazen displays of wealth."

Player_Romus

"I'd love to come. It's always good to meet a fellow proponent of the free press."

Player_Romus

"I'd love to come. I've been meaning to speak with you about how the Sordish press can cover us Rizians more favorably."

Player_Romus

"Is it really so luxurious? When you're as wealthy as we are, these celebrations become commonplace."

Narrator

He flashed me a toothy grin.

Anton Rayne (R)

"Never underestimate the value of a bit of spectacle."

Narrator

He flashed me a toothy grin.

Narrator

He flashed me a toothy grin.

Anton Rayne (R)

"Up to a point."

Marcel Koronti (R)

"What a life you and your family must lead, Your Majesty."

Narrator

He politely nudged his companion.

Narrator

My mother wore a delighted smile as the Sordish delegation left.

Hugo Toras

"Well, that went exactly as expected."

Narrator

I took a look at the line. The number of guests waiting to greet us was lower than I expected.

Narrator

Alma Saltana expressed heartfelt congratulations to both Vina and her new husband.

Narrator

Nobles from House Toras greeted Vina and Rico in droves, of course.

Narrator

Nobles from all three houses extended their polite greetings to Vina and Axel.

Narrator

But before I knew it, it was time to eat.

Narrator

It felt like an eternity before we finally got to eat.

Narrator

As the father of the bride and the King of Rizia, I was expected to open the feast with a toast.

Narrator

A new Cantuavo vintage had been bottled in Vina's honor. They'd named it "Her Royal Wine-Ness".

Narrator

Wine production had been difficult in the past years, but the Cantuavo family had still managed to bottle a new vintage in Vina's honor. They'd named it "Her Royal Wine-Ness".

Narrator

I raised the full glass in front of me.

Player_Romus

"When it comes to one's meaningful relationships, it is quality that matters, not quantity. So I am not disappointed with today's rather sparse turnout."

Player_Romus

"On behalf of the entire Rizian royal family, thank you for joining us on this most joyous of occasions."

Player_Romus

"In this time of war, it is especially important for us to gather in celebration of the love in our lives."

Player_Romus

"I thank God for bringing us together to celebrate the union of these two souls."

Player_Romus

"I am particularly gladdened to so many of our South Merkopan neighbors here. It bodes very well for the alliance we are planning."

Player_Romus

"In particular, the presence of our GRACE partners in this hall fills my heart with gratitude."

Player_Romus

"It is particularly auspicious that our distinguished guests from Wehlen could be here."

Player_Romus

"I extend a particularly heartfelt welcome to Duke Reinhart of Pales, with which our kingdom has finally reconciled after years of uncertainty."

Player_Romus

"A special mention must go to Her Excellency Beatrice Livingston, aunt of the bride and Rizia's longtime friend and protector."

Player_Romus

"I am proud to extend our traditional Rizian hospitality to our guests from Pales."

Narrator

Wiktor Smolak applauded with gusto.

Narrator

Beatrice nodded proudly, her hands folded in her lap.

Narrator

There was a round of applause.

Narrator

The crowd turned to look at Axel. He blew them a kiss with one arm around his date.

Narrator

There was a loud round of applause.

Player_Romus

"Long ago, I promised my daughter that she could marry whomever she desired."

Player_Romus

"A royal wedding is an alliance in the truest sense of the word."

Player_Romus

"Like myself and my father before me, my daughter grew up knowing that whomever she married would impact the course of the kingdom and that of our royal house."

Player_Romus

"Today marks the dawning of a new age -- not only for the Royal Family, but for Rizia as a whole."

Player_Romus

"Providence smiled upon us when the Crown Princess of Rizia fell in love with a man who happened to be my ideal choice of Prince Consort."

Player_Romus

"I knew that when the time came, Vina would do what was right for her country and her future subjects."

Narrator

Axel wrapped an arm around Vina. They smiled out at the crowd.

Player_Romus

"The union you witnessed today is more than a mere love bond. It is an intertwining of destinies."

Narrator

Vina and Rico smiled through gritted teeth.

Player_Romus

"I am proud of the Princess for boldly following her heart, even in the face of pressure to act otherwise."

Narrator

Vina looked as if she was about to start crying again.

Player_Romus

"I did not choose my daughter's husband. Her marriage was preordained by the heavens."

Player_Romus

"The new Crown Prince had to be someone who would keep Rizia strong for years to come."

Player_Romus

"And I am proud that the good name of House Toras will live on in Vina and her descendents."

Player_Romus

"And while Vina's descendents may not bear the Toras name, I know they shall still carry forth our house's spirit."

Player_Romus

"Together, the Kingdom of Rizia and the Grand Duchy of Pales shall be greater than the sum of their parts."

Player_Romus

"Duke Reinhart, you have been a formidable ally and energy partner. I could not ask for a better son-in-law."

Player_Romus

"I trust Princess Vina and Prince Consort Axel to bring Rizia and Pales into the future together."

Player_Romus

"Mr. Sazon, you have been a formidable political ally. I could not ask for a better son-in-law."

Player_Romus

"Mr. Sazon, we have not always seen eye to eye politically. But I know you will take good care of my daughter."

Player_Romus

"I trust Princess Vina and Prince Consort Manus to bring Rizia into the future. Changes are coming that not even I can imagine."

Player_Romus

"With this marriage, the noble houses of Toras and Sazon will finally be in alignment."

Player_Romus

"Rico, you are not only my cousin -- you are my friend. I know you shall bear the mantle of Crown Prince with honor and dignity."

Player_Romus

"Duke Ricardus, you have been a formidable political ally. I could not have asked for a better son-in-law."

Player_Romus

"Duke Ricardus, we have not always seen eye to eye. But I know we both care for my daughter."

Player_Romus

"I trust Princess Vina and Crown Prince Ricardus to bring Rizia into the future while protecting our proud history and traditions."

Player_Romus

"With Vina on the Royal Council and Ricardus protecting Iza, this marriage is a harbinger of peace and stability for Rizia."

Player_Romus

"Together, the Kingdom of Rizia and the Grand Duchy of Pales shall be strong enough to defeat anyone who stands in our way."

Narrator

I heard a few discontented murmurs coming from the House Toras tables.

Narrator

I heard a few discontented murmurs coming from the Sazon tables.

Narrator

Loud cheers went up from the Toras tables.

Player_Romus

"May your heirs find their own way in life, unburdened by the expectations the House Toras name carries."

Player_Romus

"And the fact that the Prince Consort is willing to sacrifice his name to marry Vina speaks volumes about his dedication to the Crown."

Player_Romus

"Your children will be Torases. Their grandchildren will be Torases. Our house's name shall reverberate through generations upon generations."

Player_Romus

"Vina shall be the first Rizian queen not to take her husband's name. Not even my grandmother Lyza could accomplish that feat."

Player_Romus

"It does not matter what name your children bear. What matters is the legacy you pass on to them -- one of love, honor and integrity."

Player_Romus

"As is God's will, our noble house will hold the throne for millennia to come."

Player_Romus

"As we make merry today, let us not forget the brave sacrifices made by our troops."

Player_Romus

"I have a confession to make. Today is a celebration of love in more ways than one."

Player_Romus

"The Toras name is a small sacrifice to make compared to the glory that is to come."

Narrator

Lucita gave me a startled look.

Narrator

Pabel gave me a startled look.

Player_Romus

"As we feast, I invite you to share not only in my daughter's happiness, but in my own."

Player_Romus

"Duchess Lucita Azaro has provided me with invaluable counsel over the past years. Now she will be taking on a new role: that of Queen Consort."

Player_Romus

"Duchess Lucita Azaro has provided me with invaluable counsel and support during the war. Now she will be taking on a new role: that of Queen Consort."

Player_Romus

"I speak of my cherished friendship with my head butler Pabel Adria, recently elevated to the status of Lord."

Player_Romus

"For those of you who don't know, I adopted a dog towards the beginning of my reign. He is the most precious thing in my life. Come here, Bruno!"

Player_Romus

"It is no secret that the Duchess of Montaklar and I have grown close. I am happy to have her by my side on this occasion."

Player_Romus

"The Duchess of Montaklar and I have grown close. I am happy to have her by my side on this occasion."

Player_Romus

"Let us not forget to thank the great and merciful God for the many blessings we enjoy today."

Player_Romus

"I'm going to assume that's your rumbling stomachs I'm hearing. Don't worry, we'll eat soon."

Player_Romus

"As you enjoy this sumptuous banquet, do not forget that it has only been made possible through the benevolence of your king."

Player_Romus

"Let the Princess' marriage bond be an inspiration to us all. I hope that I myself may someday find a love as pure."

Narrator

I saw Lucita frowning from the Azaros' table.

Narrator

I saw Pabel frowning as he stood behind our table.

Narrator

The guests from House Azaro stood and applauded.

Narrator

Prime Minister Saltana stood up and applauded.

Narrator

Jorga Azmal stood up and applauded.

Narrator

The wedding guests broke into titters.

Narrator

The wedding guests broke into astonished gasps.

Narrator

I followed Vina's eyes to the ring on Lucita's finger. Her mother's.

Narrator

The wedding guests broke into laughter as Bruno pranced between their tables towards me.

Narrator

Rico looked irritated at his dog's loss of dignity, but gave him a scratch on the ear nonetheless.

Player_Romus

"I dedicate this day to those who have brought me solace, comfort and unconditional support throughout my reign. You know who you are."

Narrator

Supreme Wiseman Azmal began applauding. He was the only one.

Narrator

My daughter burst out into wild laughter. Hugo looked white as a sheet.

Narrator

Duke Reinhart wore a look of pure consternation.

Narrator

I saw Taddeus Azaro furiously applauding from his wheelchair. The other Azaros in the hall followed suit.

Narrator

Everyone from House Azaro began applauding furiously.

Narrator

I heard speculative whispers from various corners of the hall.

Player_Romus

"SILENCE!"

Player_Romus

"We raise our glasses not only to the newlyweds, but to a future without conflict."

Narrator

The hall echoed with polite applause.

Narrator

The hall echoed with polite laughter.

Player_Romus

"I vow that by this time next year, Rizia and Pales shall be one!"

Player_Romus

"Let us lift our cups in anticipation of the day when everyone in Rizia is free."

Player_Romus

"A toast to my wonderful daughter. Vina, I will always love and cherish you, no matter your path in life."

Player_Romus

"Halaita!"

Player_Romus

"Glovurius axa Rizia!"

Player_Romus

"A proso!"

Player_Romus

"To Vina and Manus!"

Player_Romus

"Vina, no matter whom I love, I promise that you will still be the most important person in my life."

Player_Romus

"We shall lead our troops to victory, hand in hand!"

Narrator

The volume in the hall instantly dropped down to nothing. All eyes were on me.

Player_Romus

"I invite you all to cast off the shackles of history and tradition. Free your minds, and the rest will follow!"

Player_Romus

"Hand in hand, we shall protect this kingdom and everything it stands for!"

Player_Romus

"I invite you to raise your glass to love, and to its ability to build bridges that last longer than lifetimes."

Narrator

Vina had a dubious look on her face.

Player_Romus

"A final toast to the Princess of Rizia. May her beauty, intelligence and grace inspire us all."

Player_Romus

"Let us lift our cups to freedom. It is coming sooner than we think."

Narrator

All of our Wruhecist guests repeated the words. The hall filled with the sound of clinking glasses.

Narrator

All of our Rizian guests repeated the words. The hall filled with the sound of clinking glasses.

Narrator

All of our guests repeated the words. The hall filled with the sound of clinking glasses.

Narrator

As the others at my table sipped their wine, I saw grimaces appear on their faces.

Narrator

I took a sip of wine. An acrid, unpleasant taste spread in my mouth.

Narrator

Pabel leaned over and whispered in my ear.

Narrator

I took a sip of wine. It was delicious.

Pabel Adria

"The Cantuavos have outdone themselves. This one might be their masterpiece."

Player_Romus

"I hope it's a good omen."

Player_Romus

"That's not a good omen."

Player_Romus

"A sweet finish to this sweetest of days."

Player_Romus

"It doesn't matter. Nothing can ruin this day."

Player_Romus

"If you say so, Pabel."

Narrator

I looked once more at my daughter.

Narrator

The light from the chandeliers glinted off Lena's ring on her finger.

Narrator

She slouched in her seat as Rico and Hugo huddled together, speaking in concerned whispers.

Narrator

She and Manus were huddled together, speaking in concerned whispers.

Narrator

She and Axel were talking to each other animatedly, their full wine glasses all but forgotten.

Narrator

She and Manus were talking to each other animatedly, their full wine glasses all but forgotten.

Narrator

I knew that it wasn't the wine they were talking about.

Narrator

I knew she'd remember today forever.

Narrator

I knew she couldn't wait to set off for Valenqiris.

Narrator

Sordland's vice president bowed low to the ground, wobbling slightly as he straightened up.

Narrator

The sun was just beginning to rise as Hugo and I convened in the council chambers to discuss our strategy.

Hugo Toras

"This is quite the predicament, my dear nephew."

Rico Toras

"And now she's, what, left me at the altar? Do you have any idea how humiliating this is for me?"

Rico Toras

"I'm not an idiot. I knew Her Highness didn't want to marry me. But I assumed you'd convinced her, just as Father convinced me."

Axel Reinhart

"You did obtain her consent for the marriage, yes? I was under the impression she would be an enthusiastic participant."

Player_Romus

"It's my fault. I never should have forced Vina into marriage."

Player_Romus

"She didn't suddenly get cold feet. She planned this deliberately to humiliate me."

Player_Romus

"We can accomplish this union without a wedding. Pales is joining our new South Merkopan alliance, after all."

Player_Romus
